data.enText: the feeling that sb/sth is without value and deserves no respect at all
She looked at him with contempt .

data.chText: 我对那项建议当然会不屑一顾。
data.enText: I shall treat that suggestion with the contempt it deserves.

data.chText: 他对待自己子女的那种行径为人所不齿。
data.enText: His treatment of his children is beneath contempt (= so unacceptable that it is not even worth feeling contempt for) .

data.chText: 一般百姓似乎普遍看不起从政者。
data.enText: Politicians seem to be generally held in contempt by ordinary people.

data.chText: 他们对她所认为重要的价值表示蔑视。
data.enText: They had shown a contempt for the values she thought important.
a lack of worry or fear about rules, danger, etc.

data.chText: 那些消防队员已把他们自己的安全置之度外。
data.enText: The firefighters showed a contempt for their own safety.

data.chText: 他的话表明他完全无视事情的真相。
data.enText: His remarks betray a staggering contempt for the truth (= are completely false) .

data.chText: 他由于藐视法庭可能被监禁两年。
data.enText: He could be jailed for two years for contempt.

data.chText: 她因拒绝作证而被判藐视法庭罪。
data.enText: She was held in contempt for refusing to testify.

data.chText: 过分亲密就会有所侮慢
data.enText: knowing sb/sth very well may cause you to lose admiration and respect for them/it

simple_means.memory_skill: con 加强 + tempt 蔑视 → 轻视

ex.chText: 她因蔑视法庭而被关押了一周。
ex.enText: She was jailed for a week for contempt of court.

ex.chText: 他的话显示出对将军的蔑视。
ex.enText: What he said shows contempt for the general.

synonyms.bx: 指因认为某人或某事物不重要而表现出的不尊重，常后接介词 for。

ex.chText: 她的表演遭到观众嘲笑。
ex.enText: Her performance was greeted with derision from the audience.

ex.chText: 他通过嘲笑表示自己的蔑视。
ex.enText: He showed his contempt through derision.

synonyms.bx: 指对愚蠢或可笑的人或事所表示的讥讽和蔑视。

ex.enText: He looked at me with disdain.

ex.chText: 对这样一个教练，我只能表示鄙视。
ex.enText: I have nothing but disdain for such a coach.

synonyms.bx: 指因认为某人或某事不重要或不够好而表现出的毫不尊重。

data.chText: 过分亲密就会有所侮慢
data.enText: knowing sb/sth very well may cause you to lose admiration and respect for them/it

tr: a willful disobedience to or disrespect for the authority of a court or legislative body
a manner that is generally disrespectful and contemptuous
open disrespect for a person or thing
lack of respect accompanied by a feeling of intense dislike
example: the despite in which outsiders were held is legendary

value.def: If you have contempt for someone or something, you have no respect for them or think that they are unimportant.

example.ex: He has contempt for those beyond his immediate family circle...
example.tran: 他鄙视直系亲属圈子以外的人。

example.ex: I hope voters will treat his advice with the contempt it deserves.
example.tran: 我希望选民们给予其建议应有的鄙视。

value.def: Contempt means the same as contempt of court .

example.ex: Mr. Kelly was sentenced to six months in prison for contempt.
example.tran: 凯利先生因藐视法庭被判6个月监禁。

value.def: If you hold someone or something in contempt, you feel contempt for them.

example.ex: Small wonder that many voters hold their politicians in contempt.
example.tran: 无怪乎很多选民看不起他们的政治家。

partsOfSpeech.dec: at 加强 + tempt 尝试 → 尝试，企图
tempt 尝试 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 想尝试一下 → 诱惑
tempt 尝试 + atious 有…性质的 → 诱惑性的
tempt 尝试 + ing 令人…的 → 吸引人的；动人的
con 加强 + tempt 蔑视 → 轻视
contempt 轻视 + ible 可…的 → 可轻视的；下贱的
contempt 轻视 + uous …的 → 瞧不起人的
